title: On the slow phase for fixed-energy Activated Random Walks
authors: Bernardo N. B. de Limam, Leonardo T. Rolla, C\'elio Terra
abstract:
We study the Activated Random Walk model on the one-dimensional ring, in the
high density regime. We develop a toppling procedure that gradually builds an
environment that can be used to show that activity will be sustained for a long
time. This yields a self-contained and relatively short proof of existence of a
slow phase for arbitrarily large sleep rates.
